H0.text: Energy is defined as the ability to do work.

H1.text: Fuel is defined as the ability to do work.

H2.text: Heating is defined as the ability to do work.

H3.text: Momentum is defined as the ability to do work.

A4.text: Energy is the quantitative property that is transferred to a body or to a physical system, recognizable in the performance of work and in the form of heat and light.

A5.text: Only a tiny fraction of the original chemical energy is used for work.
